titles.title: Fair Trade and Reciprocity Act of 1993

To amend the Trade Act of 1974 to authorize the United States Trade Representative to respond in a reciprocal manner to foreign acts, policies, and practices that deny national treatment to United States trade.

bill.summary: 1/21/1993--Introduced. Fair Trade and Reciprocity Act of 1993 - Amends the Trade Act of 1974 to require the United States Trade Representative (USTR) to impose conditions that prohibit or limit foreign trade in the United States on those foreign countries that impose similar conditions on U.S. trade. Requires the USTR to notify the Congress of such foreign conditions before imposing such sanctions.
